documents.document: @LadyThriller69 @Uber Um, honestly confused. Why exactly "petty"?
@barrytgoldberg When I am standing and waiting, I likewise hold my hands like that, behind my back, unhandcuffed. Hardly conclusive.
@barrytgoldberg Girl is holding something. And there is weird pixelation, squared shaped, around both the man and girl. Unverifiable.
@WordsmithWyle @jodotcom Indeed. And there is weird pixelation, squared shaped, around the head of both the man and girl.
Yesterday was the trial balloon for a coup d’état against the United States. https://t.co/JcVRBcgt30
What's in a name? More than we can imagine https://t.co/EELJntpiyJ via @WritersofColour
The unbearable whiteness of history https://t.co/cub4ks8wWh via @WritersofColour
@guardiannews @guardian Maybe report on how the hashtag campaign was hypocritical, rather than just lapping it up.
@guardiannews @guardian Uber users typically don't take cabs. And Uber gave their drivers the option of supporting the strike.
@guardiannews @guardian Maybe apply a little more rigorous analysis. In no sense did they "break" the strike. It's an alternate service.
@guardiannews @guardian Explain how Uber continuing to provide its service, just like other providers did (e.g. limos), is "strikebreaking".
@jelleprins @Jimnolan2812 Exactly. This hashtag campaign was nonsensical, hypocritical and bullying. I see no reason to punish Uber.
@Jimnolan2812 @jelleprins Are you saying limo services broke the strike? Busses? AirTrain? Subway? Family picking up loved ones?
@Jimnolan2812 @jelleprins "[Uber drivers] can stop or start working in solidarity with protests whenever they want" https://t.co/giAILHfe2u
@Jimnolan2812 @jelleprins Uber is not required to support it. But they gave drivers the option. And passengers an option to get home.
@Jimnolan2812 @jelleprins Nothing makes the drivers strike inherently principled or correct as a form of protest.
@Jimnolan2812 @jelleprins They didn't break any strike. They were already providing their own service from a separate area of JFK.
This is truly scary. The Data That Turned the World Upside Down https://t.co/VSmyiaMb3g via @motherboard
@technology According to staff here the outage is worldwide.
.@technology Um, this is wrong. International flights ARE affected. Currently Sydney checkin delayed 3 hours. https://t.co/iEavhGHswf
.@Delta Ground staff in Sydney announced the worldwide outage was fixed, only to now announce their earlier announcement was premature! 😂
@angeverse I respect that you have a different opinion.
@angeverse "drivers using Uber can stop or start working in solidarity with protests whenever they want" https://t.co/giAILHwPr4
How Uber and Lyft responded to a taxi strike at JFK airport https://t.co/giAILHwPr4
@eleslie73 @tallllguy @Delta @jpwbvi The staff in Sydney are saying it is worldwide.
@BuffingActions @Delta @KLM Computer is down in Sydney. It is worldwide. Passengers cannot be checked in.
.@Delta computers down worldwide. Passengers cannot be checked in. Has Delta been hacked?
.@EliotACohen: "This is one of those clarifying moments in American history." https://t.co/i0fkY2ebfF
@angeverse ..in the country should cease till we get what we want? Uber gave passengers options. I am not horrified or upset that they did.
@angeverse Agreed, but they simply continued providing their own service from the airport. According to your logic, every business...
@angeverse What was the objective of the drivers' strike? To voice their opposition to heinous policies, or inconvenience passengers?
@angeverse So I assume you're equally upset the AirTrain, limo services, buses and subway were working? And family picking up loved ones?
@angeverse ..a wage or employment issue. It is political protest. Uber gave passengers a standard-priced transport option.
@angeverse ..opposition to heinous policies. But why should I force others to take the same form of opposition? This was not...
@angeverse Nothing makes the drivers strike inherently principled or correct as a form of protest. I'm all for the drivers voicing their...
@angeverse So what is the "fellow union" in this case? Is your beef with Uber drivers or Uber management?
@LyndaWoolard Nothing makes the strike inherently principled or correct as a form of protest. Uber is not required to agree that it is.
@LyndaWoolard What was the objective of the drivers strike? To voice their opposition to heinous policies, or inconvenience passengers?
@LyndaWoolard @Uber @USATODAY Allowing their drivers to continue providing that service is not "breaking" a strike.
@LyndaWoolard @RedDawn329 @JoyAnnReid @morganmpage @prisonculture @Uber @USATODAY ..a service from a separate area of JFK before the strike.
@LyndaWoolard @RedDawn329 @JoyAnnReid @morganmpage @prisonculture @Uber @USATODAY Okay, I see. I don't agree. Uber was already providing...
@monicatea2 @AnaMardoll It is their way of having their voice heard. Do you not speak with people you may disagree with?
@monicatea2 @AnaMardoll Uber engaged with the Obama administration. It's what businesses do to see if they can effect change in Government.
@jennygadget ..inherently principled or correct as a form of protest. Uber is not required to agree that it is. We're not protest police.
@jennygadget ..to heinous policies, or inconvenience passengers who have nothing to do do with those policies? Nothing makes the strike...
@jennygadget providing that service is not "breaking" a strike. What was the objective of the drivers strike? To voice their opposition...
@jennygadget Uber was already providing a service from a separate area of JFK before the strike. Allowing their drivers to continue...
@jennygadget By stopping surge pricing, they stopped profiteering from the strike, and gave people a normal-priced option.
@AnaMardoll I am quite the opposite, so your sarcasm and condescension is unwelcome.
@AnaMardoll Just because i don't agree with the action against Uber doesn't mean I don't support the strike, or that I'm a right-wing troll.
@AnaMardoll Are you saying limo services broke the strike? Busses? AirTrain? Subway? Family picking up loved ones?
@AnaMardoll By stopping surge pricing, they stopped profiteering from the strike, and gave people a normal-priced option.
@AnaMardoll ..inherently principled or correct as a form of protest. Uber is not required to agree that it is. We're not protest police...
@AnaMardoll ..to heinous policies, or inconvenience passengers who have nothing to do do with those policies? Nothing makes the strike...
@AnaMardoll ..providing that service is not "breaking" a strike. What was the objective of the drivers' strike? Voice their opposition...
@AnaMardoll Uber was already providing a service from a separate area of JFK before the strike. Allowing their drivers to continue...
@AnaMardoll No, I really did't understand. And after reading the reports, I still don't get it. Apologies for not falling in line.
@AnaMardoll The taxi drivers decided to strike. Uber independently provided stranded passengers with options.
@AnaMardoll I don't think they "broke" the strike. At least not in any normal concept of that term. And they turned off surge pricing.
@RSwirling @Blackamazon @Uber @ElaheIzadi Not more justification: just one article or explanation of why I should delete Uber would be nice.

@CawfeeBlues But I'm engaging with a cipher: someone not prepared to stand behind their views with their true identity. If you have one.
@CawfeeBlues No, the smart ones went where the money is. I was headhunted, and I thought it would be cool to be based in Europe.
@CawfeeBlues Whatever helps you sleep.
@CawfeeBlues Uh-huh. So the shit turnout is because you guys were busy? The point is in comparison to previous inaugurations and a protest.

I will get up and scream that your life matters – that their lives mattered – until my voice cracks and lips bleed. https://t.co/YH1NWnwYle
@CawfeeBlues Make that 3 times as many. And yes, women are great at multitasking. They can work and do all other kinds of shit as well.
@JerryDohnal And that's not counting all those in other cities in America and across the globe. So fuck you and your idiotic renames.
